rules: Rule1: Either an event is scheduled, or the system is operational.
Rule2: Provided that motion is detected by a sensor, a notification is sent by the platform.
Rule3: Whenever a temperature change is detected by a sensor, a routine is executed.
Rule4: Under the condition that a door is open as detected by a sensor, motion is detected by a sensor.
Rule5: If a window is open as detected by a sensor, then a temperature change is detected by a sensor.
Rule6: A security breach is detected by the system, or a door is open as detected by a sensor, or a window is open as detected by a sensor.
Rule7: Maintenance is needed for a device, or if an event is scheduled, then that event is logged.
Rule8: Provided that a firmware update is occurring for a device, it is not the case that maintenance is needed for a device.
Rule9: A firmware update is occurring for a device, or a hardware check is being performed on a device.

Rule10: Provided that a voice command has been received by a device, if climate control is active for a device, then whenever smart lighting is active for a device, under the condition that it is not the case that if a device is online then the system is operational, automation is paused for the system.

Rule11: If a mobile app command has been sent to a device, then under the condition that climate control is active for a device, provided that smart lighting is active for a device, whenever it is not the case that if a device is online then the system is operational, automation is paused for the system.
Rule12: Provided that a user is present in the home, voice interaction is occurring with a device.
Rule13: A user is present in the home, or a user is remote from the home.
Rule14: Under the condition that a user is remote from the home, a mobile app command has been sent to a device.

Rule15: Under the condition that peak hours mode is active for a device, if energy-saving mode is active for a device, then provided that it is not the case that if voice interaction is occurring with a device then a voice command has been received by a device, manual override is active for the system.
Rule16: Provided that high-security mode is active for a device, a device is performing local processing.
Rule17: Either high-security mode is active for a device, or standard mode is active for a device.
Rule18: If standard mode is active for a device, then guest mode is active for a device.

Rule19: A privacy concern has been raised for a device, or if guest mode is active for a device, then provided that a device is synced with the cloud, under the condition that a device is connected to the platform, the system is operational.
Rule20: Whenever data is encrypted for a device, it is not the case that a privacy concern has been raised for a device.
Rule21: Data is encrypted for a device, or only local storage is being used for a device.
Rule22: Under the condition that only local storage is being used for a device, data is anonymous for a device.
Rule23: If data is anonymous for a device, then it is not the case that a privacy concern has been raised for a device.
Rule24: Provided that the battery is low for a device, it is not the case that backup power is active for a device.
Rule25: Under the condition that a new routine has been created, a default schedule is not in use for a routine.
Rule26: Whenever an existing routine has been edited, it is not the case that a default schedule is in use for a routine.
Rule27: Provided that a routine is user-defined, a new routine has been created.
Rule28: A routine is user-defined, or a routine is system-suggested.
Rule29: Under the condition that a routine is system-suggested, an existing routine has been edited.
Rule30: Either an emergency alert has been issued by the platform, or a routine status update has been sent by the platform.
Rule31: Provided that a routine status update has been sent by the platform, a routine has been executed.
Rule32: Under the condition that a high-priority notification has been sent by the platform, if an emergency alert has been issued by the platform, then a notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule33: A high-priority notification has been sent by the platform, or a normal-priority notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule34: If a device is offline, then the battery is low for a device.

Rule35: Whenever an immediate delivery is being used by the platform, if a normal-priority notification has been sent by the platform, then provided that an emergency alert has been issued by the platform, a notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule36: An immediate delivery is being used by the platform, or a scheduled delivery is being used by the platform.

Rule37: If a push notification has been sent by the platform, then under the condition that a scheduled delivery is being used by the platform, whenever a normal-priority notification has been sent by the platform, provided that an emergency alert has been issued by the platform, a notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule38: Provided that an email notification has been sent by the platform, an SMS notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule39: An email notification has been sent by the platform, or a push notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule40: Under the condition that an urgent delivery is being used by the platform, an app notification has been sent by the platform, or an SMS notification is not sent by the platform.
Rule41: Either an urgent delivery is being used by the platform, or a standard delivery is being used by the platform.
Rule42: Whenever a standard delivery is being used by the platform, an app notification has been sent by the platform, or it is not the case that an SMS notification has been sent by the platform.
Rule43: Occupancy is detected by a sensor, or an environment change is detected by a sensor.
Rule44: Under the condition that a device is online, a device is connected to the platform.
Rule45: Whenever an environment change has been detected by a sensor, a temperature change is detected by a sensor.
Rule46: Provided that a sensor has been calibrated, under the condition that occupancy has been detected by a sensor, motion has been detected by a sensor.
Rule47: If auto-calibration is active for a sensor, then provided that a sensor has been recalibrated, the sensor is accurate.
Rule48: Auto-calibration is active for a sensor, or manual calibration is being performed on a sensor.
Rule49: Provided that manual calibration is being performed on a sensor, under the condition that a sensor has been recalibrated, the sensor is accurate.
Rule50: Whenever an entry point is being monitored by a sensor, a door is open as detected by a sensor.
Rule51: Either an entry point is being monitored by a sensor, or a perimeter is being monitored by a sensor.
Rule52: Provided that a perimeter is being monitored by a sensor, a security sensor is active.
Rule53: The security system is disabled, or if the security system is armed, then under the condition that a security sensor is active, a window is open as detected by a sensor.
Rule54: Provided that tampering has been detected on a sensor, it is not the case that the security system is disabled.
Rule55: Whenever a routine has been executed, if it is not the case that if a device is online then the system is operational, then automation is paused for the system.
Rule56: If it is not the case that if a hardware check is being performed on a device then maintenance is not needed for a device, then a system-critical failure has occurred.
Rule57: Under the condition that it is not the case that a power outage event occurs or an event is not scheduled, backup power is active for a device.
Rule58: Whenever it is not the case that a power outage event occurs or an event is not scheduled, a device is offline.

Rule59: Provided that it is not the case that if voice interaction is occurring with a device then a voice command has been received by a device, it is not the case that manual override is active for the system.
Rule60: Whenever it is not the case that a custom schedule is in use for a routine or a routine has not been modified, a default schedule is in use for a routine.
Rule61: If a sensor has not been calibrated, then the sensor has been recalibrated.
Rule62: Under the condition that a sensor has not been calibrated, it is not the case that the sensor is accurate.
Rule63: Whenever a routine has not been executed, the routine has been modified.
facts: Fact1: Smart lighting is active for a device.
Fact2: Climate control is active for a device.
Fact3: Energy-saving mode is active for a device.
Fact4: Peak hours mode is active for a device.
Fact5: A device is synced with the cloud.
Fact7: The security system is armed.
Fact8: Tampering has been detected on a sensor.
Fact9: A security breach is not detected by the system.
Fact10: It is not the case that an event has been logged.
Fact11: A system-critical failure does not occur.
Fact12: A power outage event does not occur.
Fact13: It is not the case that a device is performing local processing.
Fact14: A custom schedule is not in use for a routine.
Fact15: An app notification is not sent by the platform.
Fact16: Automation is not paused for the system.
Fact17: A notification is not sent by the platform.
